    Intro to data structure and algorithm Part I

    November 20, 2020 less than 1 minute read

    This is Part I of the intro to data structure and algo series. See others here.

       

    test code block here:

    • DFS
    class Solution:
    def subsets(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        #backtracking
        n = len(nums)
        if n==0:
            return []
        def dfs(i, curr_path, res):
            res.append(curr_path)
            if len(curr_path)==n:
                return
            for j in range(i,n):
                dfs(j+1, curr_path+[nums[j]], res)
        res = []
        curr_path = []
        dfs(0, curr_path, res)
        return res
    • BFS

    Tags: algorithm, bfs, data structure, dfs, graph
